entry.title: Re: Issue with VAT Calculation in Asset Retirement via F-...
entry.content:
Good day @AlvaroFernandezMorales 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at the following references for more details.

Post Retirement (Integrated AR) – With Customer, Manage G/L Account Master Data

Tax Configuration Options for Key Users, Scope Items for Asset Accounting

To summarise, the scenario you described about system posting the asset sale to the customer account but no VAT line appearing even though a tax code is entered when you use Post Retirement with Customer app is common in public cloud.

The VAT not appearing during asset sale posting is caused by the revenue account not being tax relevant. I recommend you set Tax Category = Output Tax Allowed on that account and ensure that your VAT code is valid. Not that the system automatically calculates and posts the correct tax when performing an asset retirement with the customer.

Steps to consider are: (See further guidance below)

  • Use the Post Retirement (Integrated AR) – With Customer app.
  • Ensure your revenue account allows output tax.
  • Repost it and VAT will be correctly calculated and shown in the journal entry.

 

Use the Post Retirment-With Customer app

Fill out the Asset number, customer, amount, and VAT code. Then proceed to show output Tax.

Go to Manage G/L Account Master Data à Choose the Accounts à Company Code Data à Highlight Tax Category = Output Tax Allowed

Next, search for Automatic Account Determination. Then show mapping between Asset Class à Transaction Key à Revenue G/L

Then, search for Manual Journal Entries App. Display the final document with Customer, Revenue, and Output Tax lines.

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: What is correct set up of Rebate sales condition type...
entry.content:
Why RES1 appears in RVAA01 instead of REA1 is because, in S/4HANA, the classic rebate processing (using REA1 and VBOX) is deprecated in favor of Settlement Management using Condition Contracts. RES1 is designed to accrue rebate amounts during billing (in RVAA01) and used again during settlement (in A10005) to calculate the final rebate amount. REA1 is not included in standard pricing procedures like RVAA01 or A10005 in S/4HANA because it belongs to the older rebate framework.

RVAA01: RES1 is used to accrue rebate amounts during billing. These accruals are posted to financial accounting.

A10005: RES1 is used again to calculate the final settlement amount during condition contract settlement (WB2R_SC or WB2R_SV).

entry.title: Re: Automatic accrual creation
entry.content: @ArunSuresh3 it's a annual accrual frequency. But it's a Time Account Type with flexible start date that corresponds to the employee's hire date anniversary. This means that almost every day an accrual should run automatically for someone.

entry.title: How to extend or disable password lifetime for SAP Datasphere database user?
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I’m currently accessing SAP Datasphere data from Google BigQuery using a Datasphere database user. Everything works fine, but I’ve run into an issue with password expiration.

The database user’s password expires every 90 days, which causes my BigQuery jobs to fail until I manually:

  1. Reset the password in SAP Datasphere, and

  2. Update the connection details in BigQuery.

I tried checking in the SAP HANA Cockpit (linked to the Datasphere tenant) to modify the password lifetime parameter, but it seems I don’t have permission or the option to change it.

My questions are:

  • Is there a way for me to set or extend the password lifetime for this database user?

  • Or is this something that SAP must configure on their end for managed tenants?

Any guidance or experience from others who have faced the same issue would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks,

entry.title: Preparation Cerification SAC
entry.content:
Hello everyone, I’m currently preparing for the C_SAC_2501 exam, and I have some doubts about a few questions. Please, I would really appreciate your help to better understand the correct answer to each question.


You have a dimension with members for product groups and products. Each product group has associated products. You want to plan by product group without disaggregating into the products.

How can you do this?

Disable allocations
Use two properties
Disable distribution
Use two hierarchies


You are creating a new public version. Which categories can you use?

Note: There are 2 correct answers to this question.

Forecast
Budget
Predictive
Actual
You are creating a script for an advanced data action. Which character designates a virtual variable member?

%
/
#
.


You have a story in My Files. You want your colleague to review and comment on the story. What must you do?

Create a Review task for the story
Add a Comment widget to the story
Include the story in a Discussion
Share with View access


What can you do to reduce the data refresh time when opening a story? Note: There are 3 correct answers to this question.

Avoid tables with more than 500 rows and 60 columns
Load widgets in the background
Avoid prompts
Use responsive pages
Use conditional formatting


You have a live data model with two dimensions: Firstname and Lastname. Users want a single dimension in the data model that displays the dimensions as Lastname, Firstname.

What must you do?

Create the combined data in the source system data model.
Create a calculated dimension in the story.
Create a dimension in the live data model.
Group the Firstname and Lastname in the data model.

 


You have a story based on an import model. The transaction data in the model's data source changes.

How can you update the data in the model?

Note: There are 2 correct answers to this question.

Refresh the import job
Schedule the import
Allow model import
Refresh the story


You have a dataset that extracts data from an SAP Business Warehouse (SAP BW) system. The data in the SAP BW system changes. How can you update the dataset?

You must refresh the story that uses the dataset.
You must manually reimport the data.
You can schedule the dataset to update on a regular basis.
You must create a new dataset.


Which SAP Analytics Cloud feature uses natural language processing?

Smart insight
Data analyzer
Digital boardroom
Just Ask feature


Which automatically created dimension type can you delete from an analytic data model?

Date
Generic
Version
Organization

entry.title: Re: Launch your Data Science Platform with SAP Business Data Cloud
entry.content:
Hi,

Nice, the same even can be done with native, enterprise databricks. or evey community edition. With FedML. Point is clear, views not tables. I have tested the funtionality with local tables and it works but not remote tables replicated for example from S/4HANA.

However, in my view the direction should be the SAP BDC connect(for production grade deployments) for Azure/Databricks since it is bi-directional with zero-copy delta share all the way to Unity Catalog that can be consumed directly by Azure infrastructure. Thus, briding the gap between both the worlds SAP and Azure ecosystem for organizations. 

Cheers, Happy blogging.

entry.title: Import to model didn't succeed because of a data locking violation SAC
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

I am encountering an issue with data locks in SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC). The data locking functionality works perfectly in our Development (Entwicklung) environment, but in the Production environment, it does not function as expected.

When I try to apply or work with data locks in Production, I receive the following error:

Import to model didn't succeed because of a data locking violation. Error code: 3005

Surprisingly, there is another model that works just fine with data locks both in Developing and Production environment.

 

Has anyone faced a similar issue or could suggest possible areas to investigate?
Any advice on what might cause data locks to malfunction in Production but not in Development would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you in advance for your support!

entry.title: Re: SAP S/4HANA Extension ledger - Use cases
entry.content:
Hello Martin, hello everyone,

Thank you Martin for the helpful blog on extension ledgers in S/4HANA 🙂

Since this blog has been around for over 5 years, I am wondering if the extension ledger restrictions are still valid for the new S/4HANA Private Cloud 2025 system.
Unfortunately, I couldn't find the listed extension ledger restrictions (No postings to vendor or customer reconciliation accounts, No postings to GL accounts with open item items management, No integration with Asset Accounting and Only very few automatic processes work with extension ledger (GL allocations)) in our SAP Help Portal (link Extension Ledger Types | SAP Help Portal) or in any SAP Note.
I was only able to find information regarding the "Extension ledger is not available in the ledger field when creating an assessment cycle for overhead costs in 'Manage Allocations'" restriction (https://me.sap.com/notes/3630370/E).

Thank you for your support or from anyone else in the community 🙂

Best regards,
Friederike

entry.title: Why are some sales documents missing in app Manage Sales Order?
entry.content:
Some SD documents that are available in app "List of sales orders VA05", are missing in the “Manage Sales Orders” app — why is this happening?

How can I display all sales documents？


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Why are some sales documents missing in app Manage Sa...
entry.content:
Ensure the sales documents searched for are really Sales Orders and not; e.g. Customer Return documents of Document category H. Manage Sales Orders only works with sales documents of doc category - C; i.e. sales orders. VA05 is a different app completely and doesn't use the same filtering process or CDS views. 

A list of alternative options for sales orders, credit memo requests, etc can be found within the SAP Help documentation or FIORI Apps Library.

Additional Details

  • We recommend that you use the List Sales Orders Without Charge (F7672) app to search for sales orders without charge and display them in the list.
  • We recommend that you use the Mass Change of Sales Documents (F5091) app to change multiple sales documents at a time.
  • To list returns orders, you can use the Manage Customer Returns - Version 2 (F4832) app and the Mass Change of Sales Documents (F5091) app.
  • To list credit memo requests, you can use the Manage Credit Memo Requests - Version 2 (F1989A) app and the Mass Change of Sales Documents (F5091) app.
  • To list debit memo requests, you can use the Manage Debit Memo Requests - Version 2 (F1988A) app and the Mass Change of Sales Documents (F5091) app

 

Below is a list of Sales documents and their corresponding document category:

A Inquiry
B Quotation
C Order
D Item Proposal
E Scheduling Agreement
F Scheduling Agreement with External Service Agent
G Contract
H Returns
I Order Without Charge
J Delivery
K Credit Memo Request
L Debit Memo Request
M Invoice
N Invoice Cancellation
O Credit Memo
P Debit Memo

following the recommendation of note 2592707 - Integration Center Scheduled Exports failing with Invalid user / Invalid job owner Exception we have also scheduled our integration jobs with a specific admin user that our admins are allowed to proxy. entry.title: Re: WIP source type "N - Costs Not to Be Included" doesn'...
entry.content:
Hello again,
Finally, SAP solved this issue,
Even though WIP source account is type "N - Costs Not to Be Included", when adding entry in "Assign WIP Accounts" it is not possible to add entry blank. It is necessary to maintain same accounts as the other entries and then save. WIP assigned accounts will disappear and then it is already possible to save changes into a transport request.
Weird solution but it works.
Thanks.

entry.title: Re: Reading Messages from PI System
entry.content:
• version: The number of the message version to read. Use -1 to read the newest version, or a number larger/equal 0 to read older versions. E.g. if there are 4 message versions existing, valid values are 0, 1, 2 and -1. Please note that 3 isn’t a valid value in this example, since -1 has to be used to read the newest message version.

No matter the version I use, always donwloads the same payload, the latest one.

Anyone faced this issue? Is it a patch level issue?

entry.title: Fetch Request token or ID Token from OAuth Grant Code Authentication
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

We are doing integration with OpenText system via SAP Integration Suite Cloud Integration. OpenText accepts only ID_Token to authenticate. We have an App which is registered in the Microsoft Azure and we generated the Client Credentials in the App. We use the microsoft login OAuth API initially to get the Access, Refresh and ID_Token and then use this ID_token to authenticate and call other OpenText API's. 

The solution is possible if I generate the refresh token in POSTMAN then use it in my Stored artifacts to generate another refresh token everytime. But I want to make this dynamic. 

I used the function getAccesTokenForOauth2AuthorizationCodeCredential to get the Access Token, but this does not return me the Refresh Token or ID_Token which is available along with the Access_Token. I tried to use the authentication using POSTMAN and the response JSON contains all these Tokens. Is there another way to get the all Tokens? Does SAP has another function with supports this? This is a critical factor for one of our integrations with OpenText which only accepts ID_Token containing the User Context.

entry.title: Debugging “unsupported_grant_type” in SAP BTP IS Cloud Integration — A Complete Walkthrough
entry.content:
Author: Ayush Aggarwal
*SAP Integration Developer | Building Reliable SAP BTP IS Cloud Integration Interfaces | Passionate about Real-World Problem Solving

🧠 Introduction

If you’ve ever integrated SAP BTP IS Cloud Integration with an on-prem OAuth token service, you’ve probably seen this frustrating response at least once:

{"error": "unsupported_grant_type"}

It looks like a backend issue — but in my case, the real problem was layered across Cloud Integration, Groovy, and the Cloud Connector.

Everything worked perfectly in Postman, yet consistently failed inside SAP BTP IS Cloud Integration.
Here’s how I diagnosed and resolved it — step by step.

⚙️The Scenario

My SAP BTP IS Cloud Integration iFlow needed to fetch an OAuth token from an on-premise endpoint (hosted on Microsoft IIS / ASP.NET) through the SAP Cloud Connector.

The expected request looked like this:

POST /token
Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded

grant_type=password&
username=API_USER&
password=MySecurePassword123!&
oauth_bearer_secret=AbCdEfGhIjKlMnOpQrStUvWxYz123456$CF)J@NcRf&
ip=192.168.0.10

In Postman, this returned a valid token instantly.
But from SAP BTP IS Cloud Integration, the response was always:

{"error": "unsupported_grant_type"}

🔍Step 1 – Verifying Headers and Cloud Connector Path

The first thing I checked was the HTTP Request Headers in SAP BTP IS Cloud Integration trace (Before HTTP Adapter).
To my surprise, it only showed Cloud Connector–related headers:

SAP-Connectivity-ConsumerAccount
SAP-Connectivity-SCC-Location_ID
SAP-PASSPORT

No Content-Type, no Accept.
That meant the backend wasn’t even treating my payload as a form submission — it was likely ignoring the body completely.

🧠 Step 2 – Encoding and Header Configuration

Next, I added a Groovy Script before the HTTP adapter to URL-encode all fields safely:

import com.sap.gateway.ip.core.customdev.util.Message
import java.net.URLEncoder

def Message processData(Message message) {
    def props = message.getProperties()
    def enc = { v -> URLEncoder.encode(v ?: "", "UTF-8") }

    def body = "grant_type=${enc(props.get('Grant_type'))}" +
               "&username=${enc(props.get('User'))}" +
               "&password=${enc(props.get('Password'))}" +
               "&oauth_bearer_secret=${enc(props.get('Secret'))}" +
               "&ip=${enc(props.get('IP'))}"

    message.setHeader("Content-Type", "application/x-www-form-urlencoded")
    message.setHeader("Accept", "application/json")
    message.setBody(body)
    return message
}

Still no luck — the same error persisted.

🕵️ Step 3 – The “Aha!” Moment: HTTP Method Was GET

After a few more trace analyses, I finally spotted the culprit:
My HTTP adapter was configured to use GET, because we were “just fetching a token.”

But OAuth token endpoints must always use POST.

Why?
Because they only parse grant_type, username, and password from the body, not from the query string.

Changing the method to POST immediately changed the server’s behavior — the request started reaching the backend handler correctly.

⚠️Step 4 – Another Twist: Groovy GString Conversion Error

Just when I thought it was fixed, SAP BTP IS Cloud Integration threw a new error:

org.apache.camel.InvalidPayloadException:
No type converter available to convert from type GStringImpl to InputStream

This happens because Groovy’s string interpolation ("${variable}") produces a GString, not a plain String —
and the HTTP adapter can’t automatically convert it into an InputStream.

The fix?
Convert the body to a plain String explicitly before setting it:

message.setBody(body.toString())

That single .toString() solved the conversion issue once and for all.

🎉Step 5 – Success!

After redeploying with:

  • HTTP Method: POST

  • Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded

  • Body: body.toString()

…the flow finally returned a 200 OK and a valid token JSON 🎯

🧾 Summary of Root Causes

Layer Issue Fix

SAP BTP IS Cloud Integration ConfigurationMethod was set to GETChange to POST
Groovy ScriptBody was a GStringImplUse .toString()
Cloud ConnectorContent-Type wasn’t passed earlierRe-add header right before HTTP adapter

🧠 Key Learnings for SAP BTP IS Cloud Integration Developers

✅Always use POST when requesting OAuth tokens — GET requests won’t parse the body.
✅Convert Groovy interpolated strings to Java strings using .toString().
✅Set Content-Type explicitly as application/x-www-form-urlencoded.
✅Read the trace logs carefully — the “Before HTTP Adapter” payload is your truth source.
✅Don’t assume that Postman and SAP BTP IS Cloud Integration behave the same — even identical payloads can differ in transport semantics.

📷Screenshots

  • SAP BTP IS Cloud Integration HTTP Receiver Adapter configuration

  • 404 Error

  • Successful token response in trace

💬Conclusion

This issue was a reminder that in integration, 99% of “backend errors” come from how we send the data, not the data itself.

After hours of debugging, the fix turned out to be:

  • One configuration change (POST instead of GET)

  • One line of code (body.toString())

Sometimes, the smallest details make the biggest difference.

 

👤About the Author

Ayush Aggarwal is an SAP Integration Developer with expertise in SAP BTP IS Cloud Integration, Cloud Connector, and data integrations across SAP and cloud platforms.
He enjoys sharing practical, real-world lessons learned from deep debugging scenarios to help fellow developers save time and effort.

entry.title: SAP B1 Web Client 2508

entry.title: SAP on IBM i Webcast: A new paradigm for <sid>ADM - not just for IBM i 7.6
entry.content:
<sid>ADM is the main user profile on IBM i to administer an SAP system at the operating system level. Sharing the password of <sid>ADM among multiple system administrators is sometimes done at customer sites but is not desired. Also, if you are running IBM i 7.6 and want to benefit from the enhanced security of multi-factor authentication (MFA) for <sid>ADM, limitations in remote file systems make it difficult. In the upcoming SAP on IBM i webcast, we will present a new SAP tool to allow SAP system administrators to sign on with their own user profiles - optionally in IBM i 7.6 with MFA - and then easily switch to <sid>ADM to perform administration tasks on their SAP systems.

The webcast is scheduled for November 18th, 2025, at 4 pm CET, 10 am EST, 8:30 pm IST. Please visit the website at   to register for the webcast. In reply, you will receive a calendar entry to your email address with all the information that you need to join the webcast.

As usual, questions are welcome during the session. Some general Q&A time is also reserved at the end of the webcast for general questions and for your suggestions about possible topics for future webcasts.

If you can’t make the live session, a replay will be made available for registrants.

We hope to see you there!

entry.title: Cost Price of item unexpectedly zero
entry.content:
Hi,

I have an item that gets purchased and sold regularly. Valuation method is Moving Average.

All of a sudden the Cost Price is zero, but the Inventory Audit Report shows a value of 0.77 on the last row:

The only out-of-the-ordinary transaction is the last row nr. 1715. A Purchase Invoice that corrects the incorrect price that was used in the Goods Receipt P/O, row nr. 1698. The invoice was backdated.

How did the system calculate a moving average cost price of zero?

Regards,

Johan

entry.title: Wrong tax calculation in MIRO
entry.content:
Hello,

I’ve noticed a 0.01 EUR difference in tax calculation during MIRO posting.

Example:
Net amount = 164.35 EUR
Tax rate = 23%
Expected tax = 37.80 EUR
SAP calculated tax = 37.81 EUR

All item prices are entered with 2 decimals (12.52, 11.55, 8.80, each with 5 units), so this doesn’t seem to be caused by item-level rounding.

Any guidance on where to check or adjust would be appreciated.

Thank you!

entry.title: FM RV_BILLING_PRINT_VIEW has not mapped billing categories B and C.
entry.content:
We have an requirement to fill  E1EDP02 qualifier [001] for rebate credit notes to support with purchase order number from ‘B1 and ‘B3’ billing types whose billing categories are B and C.

On checking further we could see the Billing Categories are hardcoded inside the FM RV_BILLING_PRINT_VIEW, they are filling the purchase document number i.e., BSTKD for document categories ‘A’ OR ‘P’ OR ‘D’ OR ‘L’ OR ‘I’.

And there is no code mentioned for Billing Category category ‘B’ and  ‘C’ to fill the purchase document number.

Our query is why Billing category B and C is not hardcoded in above standard FM RV_BILLING_PRINT_VIEW.

We have requirement to fill Purchase order number for IDOC E1EDP02 qualifier [001] for rebate credit notes B1 and B3 billing types whose billing categories B and C are not hard coded in standard FM.

Help us to know the reason why it is not mapped and how can we fulfill business requirement.

entry.title: Re: Designing UI5 Apps as Business Solution for SAP Build Work Zone - Part 2
entry.content:
Hi @theodore_abitbol 

this is really strange as to me everything seems correct. At least the app-host exists and has the correct content which fits to the URL. The xs-app.json is ok. Also the platform knows about it and calculates the URL.

Also at runtime you should find another request being sent to the same app-host, which is working. The URL should look like this:
https://dev-tal-ks9oev3t.launchpad.cfapps.eu20.hana.ondemand.com/701acd48-8d90-47d3-9921-993e6601220b.cap-ui.fdcCache_701acd48_8d90_47d3_9921_993e6601220b/~6924a2b3-72d7-4bcf-aab7-93938be7cd4f~/argon.ui.app.appcockpitruptureracine/apps/sap.ui.demo.fiorielementsapp/ui5AppInfo.json
Could you confirm that this request succeds?

In order to find the root cause we can try some things:
Is the destination SupplyControlTower_html_repo_host for the same app-host? It should not cause conflicts, but you could try to remove it.
Check the HTML5 Applications page on your sub account in the Cloud Cockpit. Is the app listed there? Open the network trace. It should do periodic calls to "getHTML5Applications" to get the list. Search for your app and extract the details especially the URLs.

Best regards
Matthias

entry.title: Re: How to add a reason field in Quality notification act...
entry.content:
Hello RaghavanKathamuthu,

unfortunately there is no customizing available for this actitivity.

You might try 304177 - Reason f.movement f.transfer posting from Q notfctn - SAP for Me, but consider its a modification.

Alternatively, you can create a Z-copy of this function module QMLR_FREE_TO_BLOCKED_STOCK, and a custom screen instead of the 1600 and add the field (imseg-grund) there. Then use the new function module in the action box customizing.

Best regards

Jonathan

entry.title: Re: Budget entity in compensation
entry.content:
Based on your screenshots, your budget is setup to be a % of salary (mode = PercentOfCurSal) and then your Component selected of Pago Adjustado is what spends money from that budget.

From what you are describing, you should be using a budget mode of PercentOfCustom field and then in the advanced options you would set the field the budget should be based on to be your budget base custom field.

Thanks,

Lesley

entry.title: SAP Ariba Procure to Order 2511 Release Key Innovations
entry.content:
Hello SAP Ariba Community, We're thrilled to share great new innovations in our upcoming release, 2511 with a strong focus on improved management of service requisitioning and overall UX improvements in Guided Buying. We are also pleased to share expanded capability in SAP Ariba Procurement Mobile app and improved user experience for catalog administrators, we hope you enjoy the highlights.

Support for Hierarchical Service Items in Guided Buying (GUIDEB-300)

Complex service procurements (for example, a laptop repair plus software maintenance and a parts kit) traditionally generate multiple requisitions, follow‑ups and approval cycles.

Service hierarchies let your teams create a single, coherent requisition that models the real delivery structure of work and items. That reduces administrative overhead, shortens cycle time to order, and gives finance and procurement better visibility into bundled spend — all of which translate to faster time-to-value and lower operational cost.

Child items can include catalog and non-catalog services or goods. For example, you can create a non-catalog request for laptop repair service (parent service) and then add software maintenance service (child item) and computer cleaning kit (child item).

Service hierarchies help to define how services are structured and delivered, improving efficiency when ordering services.

You can use service hierarchies in the following scenarios:

  • When you create a service requisition using a non-catalog request or a line item form, you can add child items using the Add Child Item button.
  • On the checkout page, you can add child items to the request before you submit it.
  • If you submit a service requistion, you can withdraw it after it's submitted or partially approved, add child items, and then resubmit it.

When you create a non-catalog request for a service, the Add Child Item button, Expected Amount, and Max Amount display on the form, as shown in the following figure:

 The following figure displays a hierarchical service request:

 

This feature can be enabled through the following parameter:

PARAM_ENABLE_NON_CATALOG_SERVICE_HIERARCHY which enables service hierarchies for non-catalog requests and line item forms.

 

Hide Interim Supplier RFQ Bids (GUIDEB-1262)

You can now configure Guided Buying to hide interim supplier RFQ bids from users and display only awarded bids.

By default, guided buying displays all bids to users. However, taking onboard your feedback, some customers may prefer to hide interim bids and display only the winning bid after it has been awarded.

This capability is available only in high-touch RFQ scenarios, where professional buyers evaluate and award bids in SAP Ariba Sourcing.

If you enable this feature there will be some subtle changes to the UI in the following screens:

  • Receive quotes
  • Awarding
  • Confirm award
  • Bid overview section
  • Compare bids (both graph and table view)

You can enable this capability by setting a new guided buying parameter PARAM_ENABLE_HIDE_BIDS_IN_HIGH_TOUCH to true.

For more information about configuring API communication, see Guided Buying Parameters for RFQs

 

Display Requisition Amount in Approver's or Watcher's Currency (PROC-1029)

Given the global nature of business these days it's quite likely approvers may be overseas, to simplify this experience for an approver we have introduced the ability to display requisition amount upon approval in the approver (or watchers) preferred/default currency.

New fields such as Total in Your Currency at the header level and Amount in Your Currency at the line level are displayed for a requisition when the requisition is sent for approval:

 Your administrator can enable the through the following parameter: PARAM_ENABLE_APPROVERS_AMOUNT_IN_LOCAL_CURRENCY

 

Support for Budget Check in External ERP System for SAP Ariba Procurement Mobile App Requisitions (BMAA-479)

Its always important to know if your cost centre has sufficient budget to allow your requisition and corresponding PO to be created. We have now expanded requisition budget check capability to the SAP Ariba Procurement Mobile app too.

In the SAP Ariba Procurement mobile app, real-time budget check is performed in the external ERP system (normally the source to check the budget against the requisition) when users submit or withdraw requisitions, and also when requisitions are approved or denied.

To enable this capability your administrator can enable the parameter: Application.Mobile.EnableRTBCInExternalERPSystem

 

Enhancements to Catalog Replication Page (CMS-1418)

With this feature, the Catalog Replication page contains a new tab called Content that allows catalog administrators to search for catalogs quickly. The new design optimizes browsing and viewing large volumes of data.

Previously, the Catalog Replication page loaded all the catalogs in the Overview and Configuration tabs, which made it difficult for users to search for catalogs.

A new tab called Content is now displayed on the Catalog Replication page. As a catalog administrator, you can search for a catalog by its name and type (subscribed or unsubscribed). By default, the number of catalogs displayed on the page is limited to 1000.

We are happy today to have covered an important set of features to benefit end users, approvers and also catalog administrators with the aim to streamline work by presenting the right information front and centre to get the job done quickly and efficiently throughout the buying process.

For further useful information:

  • Register for the Early Release Series for 2511 release- Multi-registration link and for CIM customers- P2P link  (Thanks Natalie!)
  • Resources:
    • Feature related materials
      • SAP Ariba Connect - Release Readiness (Customers except CIM)
      • Readiness Community page (For CIM customers)
    • SAP Community for Intelligent Spend Management page
    • SAP Help Portal pages - Procurement  
    • What’s New

entry.title: Re: What is correct set up of Rebate sales condition type...
entry.content:
Hi @Narendar_Bureddy, 

Regarding the presence of RES1 in pricing procedure RVAA01, I would recommend reviewing the change log for that procedure in your system. In standard SAP (at least as of S/4HANA OP 2023), RES1 is not part of the standard RVAA01 pricing procedure, and I suspect it may have been added through a customization.

Recommendation Setup:

  • In the customer billing pricing procedure (RVAA01), you should maintain the accrual condition type REA1. This allows the system to post accruals at the time of sales invoice creation, which is the expected behavior for standard sales rebate processing.

  • In the Condition Contract (via WCOCO), you should maintain both REA1 and RES1:

    • REA1 for accruals at the time of source document creation + also considered at the time of Delta accrual.

    • RES1 for settlement during partial/final/delta processing.

There are alternative approaches where only RES1 is maintained in the contract and accruals are still calculated, but this typically requires additional configuration or custom logic. SAP’s best practice still recommends using both REA1 and RES1 for full control and transparency.

Also, when inserting REA1 into RVAA01, make sure it comes after step 400 (Pricing total for Rebate Basis), unless you have specific requirements (e.g., to include/exclude freight or surcharges in your base for accrual calculation). The positioning will depend on how you define your rebate base.

Regards, 
Gauthier VICTOR

entry.title: Error “Deactivation only possible for tax codes with one period” when deactivating a tax code
entry.content:
This message appears when a tax code has multiple validity periods. Deactivation is only allowed if one period exists.

entry.title: Re: Unable to upload MTA Application Descriptor - Button missing
entry.content: Hi Wiliam,
